comments.creator: ihossu@rogers.com
comments.author: ihossu@rogers.com
comments.raw_text:
User Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 6.1; WOW64; rv:7.0.1) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/7.0.1
Build ID: 20110928134238

Steps to reproduce:

Auto update the software to V7.01


Actual results:

On Yahoo Mail, the tab containing "Online contacts" disappeared. It reappeared on Mozilla browser only a few days later, when accessing one of the contacts through an older version of Chrome.


Expected results:

The tab structure should be the same as before the update. Not sure if this is a Yahoo Mail or a Mozilla problem, as updates on both were done close one to each other.

comments.raw_text:
> 
>  It reappeared on Mozilla browser only a few days later, when accessing one of
> the contacts through an older version of Chrome.
> 

Is the problem reproducible, or was it solved after opening with Chrome once?

comments.creator: ihossu@rogers.com
comments.raw_text: After accessing the mail tab through Chrome, the tab appeared in Mozilla and did not disappear after turning off and on the Mozilla browser. It can not be reproduced. It looks as an (annoying) initialization problem. If Chrome was not an option, it would be a missing feature.
comments.text: After accessing the mail tab through Chrome, the tab appeared in Mozilla and did not disappear after turning off and on the Mozilla browser. It can not be reproduced. It looks as an (annoying) initialization problem. If Chrome was not an option, it would be a missing feature.
